title: Pub operator Greene King gets regulatory nod for merger...
text:
Oct 17 (Reuters) - Greene King Plc said on Thursday the European Commission has given the go-ahead for CK Asset , a Hong Kong-listed company founded by the territory's richest man Li Ka-Shing, to acquire the British pubs operator.

The offer by CK Asset, whose founder ranks among Asia's best-known entrepreneurs, valued the brewer of Old Speckled Hen and Abbot Ale at 4.6 billion pounds ($5.92 billion) as CK aims to boost its UK presence.

The merger is expected to close on Oct. 30. ($1 = 0.7774 pounds) (Reporting by Yadarisa Shabong in Bengaluru; Editing by Shailesh Kuber)
